SENT.plain: The authors present four cases of annuloaortic ectasia recently observed in Dakar Principal Hospital; two cases are MARFAN's syndrome, one is complicated by aortic dissection
Third cause of aortic regurgitation, this disease must be diagnosed early on account of its bad prognosis with the risk of the dissection of the aorta and issue to cardiac insufficiency
The diagnosis is more often affirmed by transthoracic echocardiography
Treatment is surgical with low operative mortality and excellent long term result
